metadata.description: A curated list of Points of Interest (POIs) for the unfold.quest project, extracted from a user-provided document.
metadata.source_document_title: Āgenskalns Market: Where History Meets Modern Culinary Culture

pois.title: Āgenskalns Market
pois.description: One of Riga's oldest and largest markets on the left bank of the Daugava River, a national cultural monument established in 1898. Recently undergoing a major renovation, it blends historic architecture with a vibrant modern culinary scene and cultural events, featuring local farmers, artisanal producers, and unique vendors.

narrative_hooks.history: Opened in 1898, construction of its iconic brick pavilion by Reinhold Schmaeling began in 1914 but was delayed by WWI, finally completed in 1925. It is the oldest and largest market on the left bank of the Daugava River.
narrative_hooks.fun_fact: During its recent four-year renovation, workers discovered and preserved original concrete floors from the market's inception, seamlessly integrating them with new materials.
narrative_hooks.architectural_detail: Features distinctive red brick architecture, designed by Reinhold Schmaeling, with a front entrance redesigned by Alfrēds Grīnbergs.

pois.title: Vārpas Farm
pois.address: Inside Āgenskalns Market, Nometņu iela 64, Āgenskalns, Riga, LV-1002
pois.description: A full-cycle farm offering over 20 varieties of pickles, ferments, marinades, and jams, made from their home-grown vegetables and berries. Specializing in traditional Latvian fermentation with a modern twist.

narrative_hooks.fun_fact: Their standout products include kimchi made with traditional Latvian cabbage and wild garlic pesto.

pois.title: Molberts Ice Cream
pois.address: Inside Āgenskalns Market, Nometņu iela 64, Āgenskalns, Riga, LV-1002
pois.description: An artisanal ice cream vendor creating 'meticulously crafted pieces of art' with unique flavors like blackcurrant cheesecake and salted caramel brownie. All ingredients are handmade and sourced from trusted suppliers, including vegan options and ice cream cocktails.

narrative_hooks.fun_fact: Their blackcurrant cheesecake-flavored ice cream is particularly renowned.

pois.title: Re-wine
pois.address: Inside Āgenskalns Market, Nometņu iela 64, Āgenskalns, Riga, LV-1002
pois.description: A unique vendor functioning as both a wine shop and Italian delicatessen, offering fresh Sicilian fruits, pistachio cream, Italian cheeses, and wines from small Italian producers. Features a summer terrace café.

narrative_hooks.fun_fact: This vendor brings authentic Italian products, like fresh Sicilian fruits and wines from small Italian producers, directly to Riga's market.
